key_points: Joe Biden criticized by families of the 13 soldiers killed in Kabul for a meeting they felt was 'scripted and shallow'.
A woman shouted at Biden to 'burn in hell' as he left Dover Air Force Base, expressing anger over his handling of the meeting.
Mark Schmitz, father of deceased Jared Schmitz, expressed frustration over Biden mentioning his own son and allegedly checking his watch during the meeting.
The veracity of Biden checking his watch during the dignified transfer is debated.
Former President Donald Trump and others criticized Biden for his actions and comments during the meeting.
Jiennah McCollum, widow of Marine Lance Corporal Rylee McCollum, and her sister described their disappointment with Biden's conversation as 'scripted and shallow'.
White House press secretary Jen Psaki defended Biden, emphasizing his empathetic intent despite the criticisms.
Darin Hoover, father of Taylor Hoover, refused to speak with Biden and criticized him for checking his watch during the dignified transfer of coffins.
Kathy McCollum voiced her grief and anger on SiriusXM Patriot, calling Biden a 'feckless, dementia-ridden piece of crap'.
Instagram temporarily deleted Shana Chappell's account, mother of Lance Corporal Kareem M Nikoui, due to her criticisms of Biden; Facebook later restored it stating it was a mistake.
spokespersons: Shana Chappell (Mother of Kareem M Nikoui)
